content:
Posted: December 25, 2013
Early Access Review
								Incredible game.  Absolutely incredible.I enjoy this game immensely, and I'm picky when it comes to crafting sandbox games when it comes to holding my attention.  The learning curve is easy, the crafting system is intuitive, the graphics appealing and enjoyable to view for hours on end, and the depth of gameplay is deep.On the surface, it may look like Terraria or Starbound with different graphics.  I can attest to the fact that this is far from the truth.  Craft The World takes the best of multiple games and puts them all into one incredibly fun package, all while adding something new to the genre.  The developers have done a phenomenal job getting this game into great shape, and even though it's still early in development, I had absolutely no issues playing an entire 25 hour campaign mission straight through.  The occasional restart will fix any major game breaking bugs that pop up, and that's about as easy as it comes when you're talking about an early release.While I've got high hopes for some unannounced features, this is and will be a solid game moving into the future.  I'm extra excited for the concept of multiplayer, so fingers crossed we'll see it in the future.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2013
Early Access Review
								Craft the World is "Game of Dwarves" with a lack of depth perception.  Heres a quick overview 6 hrs into the game.Recommend for sandbox / management gamers who have a decent tolerance of bugs and need something new.The Good -Art: Very pleasing art style, rather original style overallIntro Screen: When starting up the game the background pans around to your last save with dwarves actively moving around.  Not at all a big game changer but a nice creative touch.The Bad - A.I: Dwarves are dedicated to picking up all bits of garbage no matter how many goblins are in the wayPacing - Not sure if there’s a fast forward button, but I need to find it if there is.The Rest -Tech - Both Verity and pacing seem decent but it feels a bit grueling at times.  You don't research but simply gather mats, craft and place the object before progressing.  This means placing a mishmash of fluff around your house as you progress.

Early Access Review
								Still in alpha but an amazing game.  Like most people have stated it is a combination of terraria, minecraft, and resource management.  I haven't noticed many bugs, a few crashes here and there but it saves automatically so you don't lose anything.  The one downside is there is not a lot of guidance and it will take some time to get used to.  The campaign (at least the first level) consists of challenges trying to unlock more items to create, except for some its very confusing on how to create them (where to get materials) or finish the challenge.  Either way, it is a great game and if you think you will like it, get it.  Help them out and report what needs fixing.  This game has a lot of potential.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												It's a funny game that makes a lot of fun. My first Review was positive. I enjoy the graphics very much, and even when the game is still in early access, it is nearly coomplete und absolute playable.So why negative rating?I don't agree with the dev's way of balancing. Especially with the structure of the tech tree. There are many techs where i think: "Why is it there? And not there?" for example armor. New armor comes very late, but in late game, they all come nearly at once. Why? Why do i unlock Iron Armor, to unlock Silver Armor as soon as i crafted some Iron Armor? Only to unlock Gold Armor, as soon as i crafted some Silver Armor.Crap.Same with beds. I unlock beds Tier 2, only to unlock allready Tier 3 before i even crafted enough Tier 2 beds for my dwarves. And thats really annoying. When i need stuff, i don't get it. And when i get it, i don't need it anymore because i allready unlock better one before i finish crafting.And the other thing i don't like is the late game of each level. It's dumb digging for Portal parts. And it gets even worse with every level since the map increases in size. It's okay to dig for real progress, to get new and different ores for better equipment. But it's horrible annoying if you need to dig down the whole map only to find those portal parts when you allready have everything you need. (except the portal parts, of course.)So yeah, i like the gameplay, but tech trees and late game content really needs a change.
